data.name: Price War
data.description:
### Price War #### Goal - the goal of this kata is to optimize your revenue in a given market of supply and demand - customers have a desired quantity they want to buy for a given maximum price - suppliers have a maximum capacity they can deliver for a given price - your goal is to set the optimal price for a given capacity to maximize your total revenue #### Params - demand = array of [quantity, max_price] - supply = array of [max_capacity, price] - your capacity = max_capacity - return the optimal price to maximize your revenue #### Example - demand = [ [500, 15.00], [500, 14.50] ] - supply = [ [850, 14.85], [750, 14.75] ] - your capacity = 650 - based on the rules below the demand gets fulfilled in the original sequence [ [500, 15.00], [500, 14.50] ] - the suppliers are used up from lowest to highest price [ [750, 14.75], [850, 14.85] ] - suppose you would set your price to 14.74 - this would result in supply sequence [ [650, 14.74], [750, 14.75], [850, 14.85] ] - and gives you a revenue of 14.74 * 500 = 7370, since the second buyer does'nt go over 14.50 - if you set a price higher then 14.74, you can't sell anything and your revenue is zero because the second buyer does'nt allow prices above 14.50 - on the other hand if you set 14.50 as price both buyers will be satisfied - this would result in supply sequence [ [650, 14.50], [750, 14.75], [850, 14.85] ] - and gives you a revenue of 14.50 * (500 + 150) = 9425 - so your optimal price in this case = 14.50 #### Rules - only one product is available on the market - the demand market is supplied in sequence of appearance - customers don't pay more then their maximum price
(so only suppliers with sell-price <= maximum-price can sell to a customer) - supply is used up from lowest to highest price
(the lowest supply price is used first until it's capacity is used up, then the next, etc...) - all prices have the same currency and are scaled to 2 decimals - quantities and capacities are also scaled to maximum 2 decimals - all suppliers need to have a different price - your maximum production capacity is given - your revenue is the quantity sold of your capacity multiplied by your price - if nothing can be sold then return price 0 - in case more then one price gives the same optimal revenue, then return the price that needs the least capacity to achieve the same revenue #### More Examples ###### Example 1 - supply > demand - demand = [ [1100, 25.13], [1000, 23.10], [888, 19.19], [3000, 11.8] ] - supply = [ [5000, 17], [2000, 16] ] - capacity = 500 - => optimal price = 16.99 ###### Example 2 - demand > supply - demand = [ [100, 20.00], [50, 30.00], [300, 5.00], [5000, 25.00] ] - supply = [ [1000, 27], [500, 16] ] - capacity = 250 - => optimal price = 25.00 ###### Example 3 - more profit when not using up capacity - demand = [ [1000, 10.00], [1000, 11.00], [1000, 4.80], [400, 12.00] ] - supply = [ [1500, 4.75], [1500, 4.75] ] - capacity = 900 - => optimal price = 12.00 ###### Example 4 - no competition - demand: [ [1000, 12.50] ] - supply: [ ] - capacity: 10000 - => optimal price: 12.50 #### good luck!!!
